title: Three 2015 Old Vines Rosé (Contra Costa County)
description: A deep pink color and substantial flavors make this wine a little bigger and more wine-like than many other rosés. The red cherry and raspberry flavors and medium body will pair well grilled salmon, paella, and even slow-cooked ribs.

title: Three of Cups 2013 Le Bateleur Cabernet Sauvignon (Red Mountain)
description: Herb, red apple, copper penny and dark cherry aromas are followed by sweet, full dark cherry flavors. The tannins are firm, needing some time to soften.

title: Three of Cups 2013 Le Justice Red (Yakima Valley)
description: Grenache and Mourvèdre (40% each) are the primary components in this blend with Syrah filling out the rest. It offers unusual aromas of orange peel, lemon and herbs that lead to plentiful raspberry and tart cranberry flavors with a soft mouthfeel that brings appeal.

title: L. Tramier & Fils 2015 Romantic Chardonnay (Vin de France)
description: Based in Burgundy, Tramier should know something about Chardonnay. This wine has some structure that tastes of cool vineyards. It is crisp, with refreshing white fruit and green-plum flavors, and is ready to drink.

title: Lagar de Indra 2015 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Aromas of lime and pine give way to a tangy, angular palate. Dry apricot and citrus flavors are lively but very familiar for this variety. A modest, lightly pithy tasting finish feels juicy and fresh.

title: Lamoreaux Landing 2013 Chardonnay (Finger Lakes)
description: Soft, sunny acidity and luscious mouthfeel give this Chardonnay an overall plushness. The palate is marked by creamy peach and apple flavors accented by delicate wisps of vanilla and spice. While straightforward in style, it's supple and pleasing.

title: Sanglier Cellars 2013 Rouge Du Tusque Red (Sonoma County)
description: A blend of Grenache, Syrah, Zinfandel and Petite Sirah, this wine offers earthy cedar and meager fruit, providing instead a wealth of leathery, rustic texture and light body.

title: Winzerkeller Andau 2013 St. Laurent (Burgenland)
description: The slightest hint of blueberry rises from the glass of this light and slender red. The palate is soft and has fresh red cherry fruit and would take well to chilling. This is an easy, cheerful picnic red.

title: Avant 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: The light herbal and citrus aromas of this medium-bodied wine lead to light grassy, herbal, grapefruity flavors. A good backing of acidity keeps it lively.

title: Château Maupague 2015 Rosé (Côtes de Provence Sainte-Victoire)
description: The name of the estate means “giving little” and certainly refers to the poor, stony soil that suits vines. The 20-year-old vines give an attractive creamy-textured wine with some wild strawberry flavors and crisp acidity at the end.

title: Churchill Cellars 2013 Bella Luna Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: A big presence of oak and tannin appear first before characteristics of forest floor and an herbal back note accent mushy plum. Sizzling acidity is a surprise, given the wine's otherwise weighty sense of being.

title: Colomé 2015 Torrontés (Salta)
description: Powdery white-fruit aromas blend with notes of vanilla, lees and briny saline water. This feels fresh and lightly citrusy. Powdery, yeasty melon and tropical fruit flavors finish with notes of lychee and citrus pith.

title: Colonnara 2014 Cuprese  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi)
description: Deeply colored gold, this unusual white opens with aromas of beeswax and pressed white flower. The concentrated but rather evolved palate offers dried citrus fruit, chamomile, acacia honey and pear.

title: Commanderie de la Bargemone 2013 Cuvée Marina Red (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)
description: Aged for 18 months in barrel, this structured and firmly tannic wine has concentration, strong spice and black fruits that are still young. It will always be firm although the attractive herbal character will come through more strongly as the wine ages. Drink at its optimum in 2017.

title: Damiani 2014 Sunrise Hill Vineyard Lemberger (Finger Lakes)
description: Blackberry and cherry flavors abound in this ripe, deeply fruity Lemberger. Richly textured and robust in body, its nuanced with hints of bramble and spice. Firm tannins mark a lingering finish.

title: Domaine de la Sanglière 2015 Breezette Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: This lively, bouncing wine comes straight at you with its fruit and light, easy texture. Juicy red currant and pineapple flavors give it a clean, clear character. It's a fine apéritif style.

title: Borjón 2015 ECKS Rosé (Amador County)
description: A touch of concentration helps this wine stand out from the pink pack. The color is a vibrant pink, the aromas recall watermelon and the flavors and body are hefty enough to pair well with everything from salads to salmon to fried chicken.

title: Brunori 2014 Le Gemme  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico)
description: Aromas of fragrant broom, white wild flower and a whiff of damp earth lead the nose on this straightforward wine. The vibrant palate offers green apple and tangerine alongside zesty acidity. A slightly bitter almond closes the finish.
region_1: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico

title: Castello di Neive 2015 Montebertotto Arneis (Langhe)
description: Pretty scents of fragrant white wild flower and white stone fruit lift out of the glass. On the round, straightforward palate, fresh acidity offsets ripe Bosc pear, lemon zest and a hint of hazelnut.

title: Staete Landt 2014 Map Maker Pinot Noir (Marlborough)
description: Bright, fresh and inviting, with floral and herbal notes upfront, complemented by tart pomegranate and cranberry fruit on the palate. Drink this medium-bodied wine over the next few years.

title: Stefano Antonucci 2015  Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi
description: White spring flower and citrus aromas lead the nose on this easygoing, savory white. The juicy palate offers juicy tangerine and a note of sea salt alongside fresh acidity. It's simple but well made.

title: Ravoire et Fils 2015 Domaine Vallon des Cigales Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: Pale in color, this blend of every possible Provençal grape variety (including some whites) is classic, easygoing Provence rosé. It has wild raspberry fruit and crisp acidity. A tangy, tight mineral texture adds to its refreshing nature.

title: Nieto Senetiner 2013 Don Nicanor Red (Mendoza)
description: Jammy, floral berry aromas are a touch flat and soapy. This Bordeaux-style blend is grabby and quite tannic, while a black-fruit mix of flavors folds in peppery spice notes and char on the finish.

title: K. Martini & Son 2013 Rueslhof Lagrein (Alto Adige)
description: Whiffs of violet, blackberry and mint set the tone while the no-frills palate offers blackberry, plum and a hint of dark spice. Mellow tannins provide the easygoing framework. Drink soon.

title: Le Pépin 2015 Pinot Noir (Vin de France)
description: This is a direct but tasty and well-balanced Pinot, with vibrant aromas and flavors of juicy cherry, blueberry and wild strawberry, all graced by hints of purple flowers and sweet spice. The mouthfeel is soft yet structured, with delicate tannins and a slight lushness that lingers on the finish.

title: Maison de la Villette 2014 Grenache-Syrah-Mourvèdre Red (Vin de France)
description: There's a rich character to this blend of 50% Grenache, 40% Syrah and 10% Mourvèdre. It offers heady aromas of black cherry, boysenberry and raspberry that are laced with hints of vanilla, pepper and pencil shavings. It's well balanced and approachable, with a pleasant licorice kick to the finish.

title: Malabaila 2015  Roero
description: Pear, apricot and honeysuckle scents lead carry over to the soft, round palate along with a hint of pear. A white almond note fills in the finish.

title: Merriam 2011 Windacre Estate Merlot (Russian River Valley)
description: Spicy in cinnamon and sultry tropical coconut, this wine offers a freshness of red fruit, true and varietal, with soft, lean layers of body and weight.

title: Mascota 2015 La Mascota Chardonnay (Mendoza)
description: Grassy aromas include notes of citrus, apple, wheat and pool water. This feels fruity and a touch pulpy. Tropical, briny white-fruit flavors are pithy and finish light in weight, citrusy in flavor and ultimately a touch bitter.

title: Giacomo Vico 2015  Roero
description: Lightly scented, this medium-bodied white opens with whiffs of white spring flower and orchard fruit. The soft, round palate offers mature pear, citrus peel and a hint of toasted hazelnut.
